quotes.quote: Upon the conduct of each depends the fate of all.
There is no stability without solidarity and no solidarity without stability.
The first step in the evolution of ethics is a sense of solidarity with other human beings.
You don't fight racism with racism, the best way to fight racism is with solidarity.
Solidarity was the best thing which happened in the 20th century.
The most important word in the language of the working class is "solidarity."
If someone puts their hands on you make sure they never put their hands on anybody else again.
Solidarity and competitiveness are the two sides of a European coin.
You can't always be demanding solidarity from others and then refuse to show it yourself.
Solidarity is based on the principle that we are willing to put ourselves at risk to protect each other.
There will be no equity without solidarity. There will be no justice without a social movement.
A people cannot exist if there is no social solidarity.
There is no true peace without fairness , truth , justice and solidarity.

Solidarity is not a feeling of vague compassion or shallow distress at the misfortunes of so many people, both near and far. On the contrary, it is a firm and persevering determination to commit oneself to the common good; that is to say to the good of all and of each individual, because we are all really responsible for all.
Solidarity is not discovered by reflection but created.
Solidarity between women can be a powerful force of change, and can influence future development in ways favourable not only to women but also to men.
Great opportunities to help others seldom come, but small ones surround us every day.
Solidarity is not an act of charity, but mutual aid between forces fighting for the same objective.
The purpose of human life is to serve and to show compassion and the will to help others.
With solidarity, you will be more talented and handier, you will be taller and stronger, faster and wiser!
He who once became aware of the power of Solidarity and who breathed the air of freedom will not be crushed.
Coming together is a beginning; keeping together is progress; working together is success.
We must indeed all hang together, or, most assuredly, we shall all hang separately.
A sense of solidarity among fifteen-to-thirty-year-olds would be a menace to civilized society even in the best of times.
We must learn to live together as brothers or perish together as fools.
Every human being is called to solidarity in a world battling between life and death.
It is wonderful to be in solidarity with another big group of people.
Sometimes we find the sweetest solidarity in the midst of solitude.
True solidarity is only possible among the solitary.
We must speak our minds openly, debate our disagreements honestly, but always pursue solidarity.
